unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Load Shedding Intensifies Across Northern India**
normalised: energy and utilities colon load shedding intensifies across northern india

unnormalised: New Delhi, November 8th - Unscheduled power outages, commonly known as load shedding, have intensified across several northern Indian states, including Uttar Pradesh and Haryana, exacerbating existing concerns about energy infrastructure reliability. The disruptions, lasting up to 4 hours in some rural areas, are reportedly due to a combination of increased demand and insufficient coal supplies at thermal power plants.
normalised: new delhi, november eighth - unscheduled power outages, commonly known as load shedding, have intensified across several northern indian states, including uttar pradesh and haryana, exacerbating existing concerns about energy infrastructure reliability. the disruptions, lasting up to four hours in some rural areas, are reportedly due to a combination of increased demand and insufficient coal supplies at thermal power plants.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, Director of the National Power Grid Corporation, cited unforeseen technical glitches at the Dadri power plant as a contributing factor. He added that efforts are underway to restore normalcy. The rising demand is partly attributed to the festive season, with increased lighting and appliance usage.
normalised: doctor sharma, director of the N A S A national power grid corporation, cited unforeseen technical glitches at the dadri power plant as a contributing factor. he added that efforts are underway to restore normalcy. the rising demand is partly attributed to the festive season, with increased lighting and appliance usage.

unnormalised: Farmers in Punjab have voiced concerns about irrigation schedules being disrupted, potentially impacting crop yields. Residents in Delhi suburbs have also reported frequent power cuts, affecting businesses and households alike. The Power Ministry has announced an allocation of Rs. 500 crore to address the coal shortage. Areas of new construction, spanning 10,000 sq ft, are experiencing particular hardship due to reliance on electricity for operations. Further updates are expected by November 10th.
normalised: farmers in punjab have voiced concerns about irrigation schedules being disrupted, potentially impacting crop yields. residents in delhi suburbs have also reported frequent power cuts, affecting businesses and households alike. the power ministry has announced an allocation of rupee five hundred crore to address the coal shortage. areas of new construction, spanning ten thousand square feet, are experiencing particular hardship due to reliance on electricity for operations. further updates are expected by november tenth.
